info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 1:30PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Custer and north central Fall River Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 130 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles northeast of Cold Brook Reservoir, or 5 miles north of Hot Springs, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hot Springs around 145 PM MDT. Buffalo Gap around 150 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Maverick Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
